meta.title: Jewish Demographics & Historical Communities Map | Interactive Timeline
meta.description: Explore interactive maps of Jewish communities worldwide, tracking demographic changes and migration patterns throughout history. Discover kehillot and Jewish diaspora population data across time.

about.title: About This Project

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.description: This interactive visualization explores the demographic history of Jewish communities worldwide, tracking population changes and migration patterns from ancient times to the present. The map displays Jewish communities (kehillot) with their estimated populations at different historical periods, allowing users to understand the ebb and flow of Jewish life across centuries.

features.title: Features
items: Interactive Timeline: Navigate through 3,400+ years of Jewish history
Population Visualization: Community markers show population size and confidence levels
Historical Events: Major events and persecutions that shaped Jewish demographics
Migration Patterns: Visual representation of Jewish diaspora movements
Multilingual Support: Place names in local languages and English
Educational Resources: Links to historical sources and references

dataSources.title: Data Sources
dataSources.description: The data combines historical records, archaeological findings, demographic studies, and scholarly research. Population estimates are based on available historical sources and may include approximations for demonstration purposes. Sources include academic publications, historical documents, and established demographic databases.

howToUse.title: How to Use
items: Use the timeline slider to navigate through different time periods
Click on community markers to see detailed information
Hover over timeline markers to learn about historical events
Use the play button to animate through time automatically
Switch between different map views and language options

about.note: Note: This visualization is under development. Some data points are estimates or approximations for demonstration purposes and have not been fully verified. We welcome feedback and corrections from historians and researchers.

tour.title: Interactive Tour
tour.selectLanguageDescription: Choose your preferred language for the interactive tour

steps.title: Welcome to the Jewish Demographics Map
steps.content: This interactive map shows Jewish communities throughout history. Use the timeline at the bottom to explore different time periods.

steps.title: Timeline Navigation
steps.content: The timeline slider allows you to navigate through 3,400+ years of Jewish history. Drag the slider or use the play button to animate through time.

steps.title: Community Markers
steps.content: Each marker represents a Jewish community. The size indicates population, and colors show different types of communities or events.

steps.title: Historical Events
steps.content: Hover over the timeline markers to see major historical events that shaped Jewish demographics and migration patterns.

steps.title: Map Controls
steps.content: Use the controls above the timeline to change map views, search for cities, adjust clustering, and switch between different map layers.

steps.title: Language Options
steps.content: Switch between different map languages and views to see place names in their local languages or in English.

steps.title: Population Information
steps.content: Click on any community marker to see detailed population information, historical context, and related resources.

steps.title: Explore and Learn
steps.content: You're now ready to explore Jewish history through this interactive visualization. Use all the controls to discover the rich tapestry of Jewish communities across time and space.

workInProgress: Work in Progress: This visualization is under development. The data has not been verified and some numbers are estimates or approximations for demonstration purposes.
